recipes: Dark days. I must be careful not to let doubts creep in. [Dread or Injury may provoke full-fledged Despair.]
Despair is the wolf that devours thought. [You can defeat Despair by feeding it Contentment; otherwise, it will destroy you when it reaches 3 Dread or Injury]
This is almost the end - [Find Contentment now, or it's over.]
Where will they find me? I am not here.
Consider (1) allowing the threshold to grab Dread too. (2) allowing the active step to have a low-risk possibility of increasing Dread (3) providing a reward when Despair is defeated
Memories of better times keep the wolf from the door. [Each Contentment destroys one Dread or Injury.]
The wolf Despair prowls elsewhere, now. [No Dread or Injury empowers this Despair. It's over, for now.]
The sun flickers like a shadow. Dreams ripple behind the surface of mirrors. I must be careful not to drift from the waking world. [Fascination may provoke Visions]
Paintings whisper. Windows wink. I know these things are not true, but how can I be certain? [You can defeat Visions with Contentment; otherwise,  you will lose yourself completely at Fascination 3.]
What is the light that brims the surface of everyhing? The Glory is coming, but I cannot be here to see it - [Find Contentment now, or it's over.]
Where will they find me? I am not here.
The solidities of earthly pleasure banish the phantoms. I tether myself to the everyday.[Each Contentment quells one Fascination.]
Mirrors are calm. The sun is steady. The Glory recedes. I am sane, if that means anything. [No Fascination drives your Visions. It's over, for now.]
